bibl.title: Letter from Hugh L. Scott to Harry Frederick Jackson, January 21, 1901

div1.p: Scott informs Jackson that a $2 per diem allowance has been approved for Reed and for Carroll. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Hugh L. Scott to Harry Frederick Jackson, January 21, 1901
div1.opener:
HH
HEADQUARTERS
DEPARTMENT OF CUBA
Office of the Adjutant General,
HAVANA
January 21, 1901.
Lieut. H. F. Jackson, 2nd Art.,
In Charge of Sanitation,
Quemados, Cuba.
Sir:-
div1.p:
I am directed by the Military Governor to inform you
that upon the recommendation of the Chief Surgeon he has
approved a per diem allowance of two dollars ($2) each to
Major Walter Reed and Acting Assistant Surgeon James Carroll,
in charge of Experimental Station, Camp Columbia, in view of
the great value of their services to Cuba, and their increased
expense while here.

This will, be estimated for by you monthly on your
regular estimate under the head of SANITATION. You will also
estimate in your next monthly estimate for back allowances to
date from July 1st, 1900.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, H.L. Scott Adjutant General.
1901
C. F.
374.
